intro: Luma correifolia, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces fruits that are capsules containing numerous seeds. It thrives in coastal areas and is often found in dry, sunny habitats. Luma correifolia is an important species in Hawaiian ecosystems and has cultural significance to the native people.
